nodes.bodyText:
There is no class ASTStateExpression - so this equals always return "true"...
Did you mean "ASTStatementExpression"?
That's by the way one example, why using toString is bad: It didn't show you this error during compile time...

You have to keep the base class PmdRuleTsts - this provides all the magic to execute the rule test cases. Now you disabled a bunch of tests...
More background info: https://pmd.github.io/latest/pmd_userdocs_extending_testing.html

I'd say, these tests are too fine granular. They do basically a white box testing - they verify that java works as it should, but don't verify, that the rule does what it should...
Please remove your test cases here and create a real test case: https://pmd.github.io/latest/pmd_userdocs_extending_testing.html
The test cases for AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops can be found here:
https://github.com/pmd/pmd/blob/master/pmd-java/src/test/resources/net/sourceforge/pmd/lang/java/rule/performance/xml/AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops.xml
Please extract astName.getNameDeclaration().getName() into a local variable. You use it 8 times. If I read the code correctly, that's actually the variable's name.

The same comment applies here as well: Please re-enable the rule tests and add additional test cases to https://github.com/pmd/pmd/blob/master/pmd-java/src/test/resources/net/sourceforge/pmd/lang/java/rule/performance/xml/UseStringBufferForStringAppends.xml
